newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Mother of Rabin killer protests at U.S. embassy.
newsitem.headline: Mother of Rabin killer protests at U.S. embassy.

text.p: Geula Amir, whose son Yigal assassinated Israeli prime minister Yitzhak Rabin, protested on Thursday outside the U.S. embassy in Israel, complaining she was not getting a visa to enter the United States.
"I want to protest. I'm not getting a visa," she told Israel's army radio outside the embassy in Tel Aviv.
"There is no reason for me not to get a visa. I don't have a criminal record."
The embassy, asked to respond to Amir's statement, said it could not comment on the status of visa requests.
But a U.S. official speaking on condition of anonymity said her request was still pending.
Yigal Amir is serving a life sentence for the 1995 assassination and his brother Hagai is serving 12 years for being an accomplice.
The radio said Geula Amir had a speaking tour arranged in the United States.
She said: "There are television crews waiting for us there and we want to work for Hagai and (improving) his conditions."
Asked by Israel's Channel Two Television why she was not also campaigning for Yigal, the mother said cryptically: "Yigal has his own story. In six months he'll raise the issues."
